newsitem.title: GERMANY: Computer 2000 to finish U.S. reorganisation in '97.
newsitem.headline: Computer 2000 to finish U.S. reorganisation in '97.

text.p: German computer wholesaler Computer 2000 AG said Wednesday it would complete a reorganisation of its U.S. subsidiary this year and put the group back on the road to positive results.

"Then the positive profit development in almost all the country units and our strong position in international competition will be seen in group profit," said Chief Executive Walter von Szczytnicki at the company's annual meeting.
Computer 2000 said earlier this month that as a result of losses at AmeriQuest Technologies Inc. it would report a group net loss for the year and probably omit a dividend.
Szczytnicki said the company was striving to pay a dividend again in 1997/98.
In the first half of business year 1996/97, Computer 2000 sales rose 23 percent to 4.3 billion German marks ($2.5 billion), while reporting a pretax loss of 38 million marks ($22 million).
AmeriQuest would concentrate its activities on its Advanced Systems Group, a distributor of workstations and servers. It planned to close some warehouses, cut its workforce and sell some operations.

German diversified utility Viag AG, which owns a 75 percent stake in Computer 2000, on Tuesday said it would take direct control of the unit. Previously Computer 2000 was controlled by Viag's Kloeckner & Co. subsidiary.
